Function Documentation

int min_if_cancel_case ( unsigned int  runtime_id  ) 

Function used to cancel selected test case

Parameters:
runtime_id runtime identifier of test case, returned by min_if_exec_case
Returns:
result of operation : 0 if test case execution was cancelled, -1 if test case is already cancelled or if case is not running, -3 if invalid argument passed, -4 in case of unspecified internal error

int min_if_close (  ) 

Function used to close min test framework

Returns:
result of operation : 0 if success, -1 in case of error

int min_if_exec_case ( char *  module,
unsigned int  id 
)

Function used to execute selected test case

Parameters:
module - name of module
id identifier of test case
Returns:
runtime identifier of the test case, -1 in case of error

int min_if_get_cases ( module_info **  modules  ) 

Function used to fetch test modules and test cases info from min engine

Parameters:
modules pointer to module_info structures, if function completes successfully, this will point to array holding fetched data, in case of failure it will be set to NULL
Returns:
number of fetched modules if function is successfull, otherwise

int min_if_message_received ( char *  message,
int  length 
)

Function called when message received from external controller

Parameters:
message string containing actual message
length length of message (this param will probobly be dropped
Returns:
result of operation

int min_if_module_add ( char *  module_name,
char *  conf_name 
)

Function used to handle add_module command from external controller

Parameters:
module_name string with module name (NULL terminated string)
conf_name name of config file, can be NULL if no testcase file given.
Returns:
result of operation - 0 if all was ok, -1 if module not found . NOTE: this function only writes module name to variuable storing data of module to be added, and checks if actual file exists. Actual "instantiation" of module is done in min_if_get_cases

int min_if_open ( min_case_complete_func  complete_cb,
min_case_print_func  print_cb,
min_extif_message_cb_  extifsend_cb,
char *  engine_ini,
char *  envp[] 
)

Function used to open min test framework

Parameters:
engine_ini path to engine settings file, provided by external controller; file can contain engine options and module definitions; can be NULL if parameter not specified
complete_cb test case complete callback function
print_cb test case print callback function
extifsend_cb "external controller send" callback function
envp pointer to environment variables as in main(arc,argv,envp)
Returns:
result of operation : 0 if success, -1 in case of error

int min_if_pause_case ( unsigned int  runtime_id  ) 

Function used to pause selected test case

Parameters:
runtime_id runtime identifier of test case, returned by min_if_exec_case
Returns:
result of operation : 0 if test case execution was paused, -1 if test case is already paused, -2 if case is not running, -3 if invalid argument passed, -4 in case of unsepcified internal error

int min_if_resume_case ( unsigned int  runtime_id  ) 

Function used to resume execetution of previously paused test case

Parameters:
runtime_id runtime identifier of test case, returned by min_if_exec_case
Returns:
result of operation : 0 if operation was successful, -1 if test case is running (was not paused ) , -2 if case is not running (not started or already finished), -3 if invalid argument was passed, -4 in case of unspecified internal error

int min_if_set_device_id ( int  device_id  ) 

Function used to set device_id for external controller

Parameters:
device_id value of device id assigned by external controller
Returns:
result of operation - always 0, since only failure that can occur in this function will be indicatet by signals, e.g segmentation fault, abort and such.
